collection: Executive Pulse: 6 metrics you should check every morning.
card_description:
PROJECTED SALES
Shows the amount of sales revenue over time (Maximum 4 quarters) and forecasts revenue for this period. Compare forecasts to your goals and make adjustments, as necessary.

collection: Executive Pulse: 6 metrics you should check every morning.
card_description:
BOTTOM SALES REP CLOSES
Ranks the 10 bottom performing sales reps by closed opportunities. Follow up with the reps to determine if they need additional training or other help to improve performance.

collection: Sales Reps: Recognize, reward and position your top talent for top performance.
card_description:
TOP 10 CLOSERS
Ranks the top 10 performing sales reps by number of deals closed. Reward top performers and leverage their experience closing deals to help jumpstart stalled opportunities. Consider refocusing top closers to higher value deals to increase their revenue impact.

collection: Leads and Opportunities: See where most of your prospects are coming from.
Executive Pulse: 6 metrics you should check every morning.
card_description:
SALES PIPELINE
Shows total open opportunity value by stage. Analyze deals in each stage of the pipeline for amount and quality. Maintain a healthy pipeline by focusing on shrinking stages. To achieve current period growth, focus on high probability sales in the later stages of the pipeline.

collection: Sales: What you can do today to exceed your sales goals.
card_description:
AVERAGE SALES CYCLE
Measures the average sales cycle length in days for deals closed. Decrease average sales cycle by training sales staff on messaging, positioning and on guiding prospects through a clear decisioning process.

collection: Executive Pulse: 6 metrics you should check every morning.
card_description:
TOP SALES SOURCES
Shows the revenue generated by lead source as a percentage of total revenue. Combine this data with average deal size and budget by source to identify over/under-performing sources. Reallocate funds to top performing sources.

collection: Leads and Opportunities: See where most of your prospects are coming from.
card_description:
OPEN OPPORTUNITIES
Tracks the number of open opportunities by pipeline stage in the specified period. Too many lagging opportunities can indicate an ineffective process. Opportunities in the later stages should be prioritized to convert in the current period.

collection: Executive Pulse: 6 metrics you should check every morning.
card_description:
LEADS, CLOSES, AND WINS
Shows the number of leads as a total of open, closed and won opportunities over the specified period. Find trends in closed deal growth to identify sales best practices.

collection: Sales Reps: Recognize, reward and position your top talent for top performance.
card_description:
BOTTOM SALES REP WINS
Ranks the 10 lowest performing sales reps by won revenue. Follow up with the reps to determine if they need additional training or other help to improve performance.

collection: Leads and Opportunities: See where most of your prospects are coming from.
card_description:
GLOBAL LEADS
Displays the number of non-US leads by country for the specified period. Assign resources to the countries where you are having the most success or identify new markets where you can increase activity to acquire more leads.

collection: Leads and Opportunities: See where most of your prospects are coming from.
card_description:
CLOSE RATE
Compares the close rate against the number of deals won and the total leads in the specified period. These metrics direct your focus so you can increase deals while maintaining a high close rate.

Close Rate = Deals Closed / Leads

collection: Executive Pulse: 6 metrics you should check every morning.
card_description:
TOP SALESPEOPLE
Displays the top 10 salespeople by won revenue. Identify over-performers and understand the secrets to their success.

collection: Sales: What you can do today to exceed your sales goals.
card_description:
WIN RATE
Compares the win rate against the number of deals won and the number of deals closed over the specified period. Attack declining win rates with targeted objection handling and performance incentives. Long-term declines can indicate problems with lead source and opportunity qualifying.

Win Rate = Wins / Deals Closed

collection: Sales Reps: Recognize, reward and position your top talent for top performance.
card_description:
TOP 10 SALES REPS
Ranks the top 10 performing sales reps by won revenue. Reward top performers and leverage their experience to mentor ramping sales reps. Keep top reps on high-value opportunities to maximize their revenue impact.

collection: Sales: What you can do today to exceed your sales goals.
card_description:
SALES FUNNEL
Shows total open opportunity value by stage. Analyze deals in each stage of the pipeline for amount and quality. Maintain a healthy pipeline by focusing on shrinking stages. To achieve current period growth, focus on high probability sales in the later stages of the pipeline.

collection: Sales Reps: Recognize, reward and position your top talent for top performance.
card_description:
OPPORTUNITIES BY REP
Ranks sales reps by the number of open opportunities.   Combine with opportunity stages and aging to identify reps who aren't managing their opportunity pipeline. Clean out stale opportunities and reassign quality opportunities that have been neglected to increase close rates.

collection: Sales Reps: Recognize, reward and position your top talent for top performance.
card_description:
CYCLE LENGTH
Ranks all sales reps by average sales cycle length. Combine this data with open opportunities and average deal size to ensure proper pipeline management. Clear out stalled opportunities to refocus attention on higher value opportunities. Mentor reps who with below-average cycle lengths.

collection: Leads and Opportunities: See where most of your prospects are coming from.
Sales: What you can do today to exceed your sales goals.
card_description:
SALES TREND
Tracks total sales and average sale size over the specified period. Increase revenue by keeping the sales team focused on target deal size. Combine this data with time spent per deal to prioritize higher value deals over smaller but time-consuming deals.

Average Sale Size = Total Sales Revenue / Number of Sales
